alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clarendon and east central Orangeburg Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santee State Park, or 19 miles north of Saint George, moving east at 5 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santee, Eutawville, Vance, Mill Creek Marina and Campground, and Indian Bluff Recreation Park. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 92 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
